item.description:
Guide your squadron of spaceships to conquer the solar system! But be careful, with planet storms and other beings trying to conquer planets too, you’re in one heck of a battle.

About: Cosmic Havoc can be played by one, two, three or four players that play sequentially.

Fight your way for control of the solar system - controlling the planets on the board. Space ship shaped discs are used by players by flicking them into the holes (planets). The game is played by spinning the Spaceship dial to select a planet to conquer. There are 3 rotating rings on the board which assists in creating Havoc in the Solar System. Players play in the following steps:

A Spaceship Spinner is used to determine which planets players try to flick their spaceship into. Once a planet is landed on with the Spinner, players draw Havoc Cards which tells how many spins the planet's-ring should be spun. Players then flick their spaceship in the direction of the selected planet and aim to land their spaceship. If a players spaceship lands in the planet, that planet is now controlled by the player and the planet is conquered. Up conquering a planet, the conqueror draws a Planet Card and follows the instructions on the card.

And then the next player spins the "Spaceship" dial again and play continues as per the above instructions.

About the board: The board is circular and contains 3 rings where the planets are located and in the middle of the board the sun is located - which holds the Spaceship Dial. Each of the rings turns either clockwise or counter clockwise. The board is divided into twenty quadrants.

Spaceship Disks: Each player starts with 16 Spaceship Discs
Cards: Planet and Havoc Cards
Planet Holes: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn:
Uranus, Neptune. Other holes the Sun and Black holes.

—description from the publisher
